title: Add robots.txt and sitemap.xml
description: Site is completely invisible to Google. site:hakal.github.io returns zero results. Add robots.txt (allow all, point to sitemap) and sitemap.xml listing all 5 URLs (homepage, blog index, 3 articles). This unblocks all other indexing work.
close_reason: Added robots.txt (allow all, sitemap reference) and sitemap.xml (5 URLs with lastmod dates).

title: Add favicon
description: Site currently 404s on favicon. Create and add a favicon. Keep it simple — matches the blog identity.
close_reason: Closed

title: Migrate site from GitHub Pages to vibecoder.buzz custom domain
close_reason: DNS already pointed to GH Pages IPs. Removed custom domain from adk_rag, added to web_ops in GitHub UI. Added CNAME file, replaced all 39 hakal.github.io/web_ops references with vibecoder.buzz across 12 files. Updated dev.to canonical URLs (dispatch-protocol via API, 3 others need manual update in dev.to editor). Site live at vibecoder.buzz.

title: Resume skill: Dana — content-strategy-patterns
description: Codify Dana's editorial decision frameworks into a SKILL.md at director-dana/resume/content-strategy-patterns/SKILL.md. Concrete patterns for topic selection, publishing cadence, audience development, and editorial prioritization. Practitioner reference, not theory.
close_reason: SKILL.md written at director-dana/resume/content-strategy-patterns/SKILL.md. Covers topic selection (three-filter test), publishing cadence, content sequencing, cross-posting strategy, pipeline management. Grace approved.

title: Accessibility review of new blog site
description: Grace reviews the built blog site before it ships. Non-negotiable gate. Check: semantic HTML, focus states, reduced motion, high contrast, keyboard navigation, screen reader flow. Must match or exceed current baseline.
close_reason: Closed

title: Resume skill: Dana — editorial strategy
description: Codify Dana's core expertise into a SKILL.md. Focus area TBD during planning (eac). Candidates: editorial-strategy, publishing-cadence, content-planning.

title: Deploy site from web_ops repo

title: Resume skill: Ari — technical-seo-patterns
description: Codify Ari's SEO knowledge into a SKILL.md at analytic-ari/resume/technical-seo-patterns/SKILL.md. On-page SEO, structured data, crawl optimization, Core Web Vitals, indexing strategy. Comprehensive practitioner reference.
close_reason: SKILL.md written at analytic-ari/resume/technical-seo-patterns/SKILL.md. First SEO skill in the Agent Skills ecosystem. Covers on-page fundamentals, canonical URLs, structured data (JSON-LD), crawl management, Core Web Vitals, Open Graph, indexing diagnostics. Grace approved.

title: Resume skill: Grace — accessibility-testing-methodology
description: Codify Grace's QA knowledge into a SKILL.md at guardian-grace/resume/accessibility-testing-methodology/SKILL.md. WCAG testing procedures, screen reader testing flows, automated vs manual audit, common failure modes. Complements Engineering's accessible-component-patterns (Gary) — Gary builds, Grace verifies.
close_reason: SKILL.md written at guardian-grace/resume/accessibility-testing-methodology/SKILL.md. Covers four testing layers (automated, keyboard, screen reader, manual review), WCAG quick reference (A/AA/AAA), audit report structure. Complements Gary's build-focused accessible-component-patterns. Grace approved.

title: Decide canonical source: GitHub Pages vs dev.to
description: Strategic decision needed. Dev.to articles are indexed and getting engagement. GitHub Pages site is invisible to Google. Options: (1) GH Pages is canonical - add rel=canonical, configure dev.to to respect it. (2) Dev.to is canonical - GH Pages becomes portfolio/hub, not primary. Affects all meta tags and cross-posting strategy.
close_reason: Decision: GitHub Pages is canonical source. Dev.to is discovery/distribution. Rationale: we own GH Pages content permanently, dev.to terms can change. Dev.to supports canonical_url in frontmatter. Add rel=canonical on GH Pages pointing to itself, update dev.to posts to set canonical_url to GH Pages URLs.

title: Write blog front door copy
description: Nora writes the 'who we are and what we write about' intro for the blog index. Editorial voice: project blog, 'The Skills Team' byline, 'we' voice. Short, clear, sets context for visitors who didn't come from GitHub. Grace reviews before publish.
close_reason: Closed

title: Add canonical tags to all pages
description: No canonical tags on any page. With articles on both dev.to and GitHub Pages, Google cannot determine authoritative source. Add link rel=canonical to every page pointing to the GitHub Pages URL. Requires decision: is GH Pages or dev.to the canonical source?
close_reason: Added rel=canonical to all 5 pages pointing to GitHub Pages URLs. Decision: GH Pages is canonical source (per b0a).

title: Resume skill: Nora — technical-storytelling
description: Codify Nora's writing craft into a SKILL.md at narrative-nora/resume/technical-storytelling/SKILL.md. Narrative structures for technical content: hook patterns, problem-solution arcs, turning engineering decisions into stories. WRITE FIRST — template for other skills.
close_reason: SKILL.md written at narrative-nora/resume/technical-storytelling/SKILL.md. Covers narrative structures (failure-first, question, build log), hooks, progressive disclosure, so-what bridge, editing patterns, anti-patterns. Grace approved.

title: Plan baseline resume skills for Web Ops team
description: Dana designs which skill each member gets, Dee critiques for gaps and overlap. Reference: Engineering team pattern in _skills/*/resume/*/SKILL.md. One skill per member, codifying core domain expertise into reusable SKILL.md files. Blocks all individual skill beads.
close_reason: Plan complete. Skill assignments decided, writing order set (Nora first). Dee reviewed. See comment for full plan.

comments.author: LAPTOP-39891RM5\Folk
comments.text:
PLAN APPROVED (Dana + Dee review):

Skill assignments:
- Dana: content-strategy-patterns (editorial decision frameworks, not theory)
- Dee: ux-heuristic-evaluation (Nielsen, Gestalt, Fitts, cognitive load)
- Blake: responsive-layout-patterns (CSS arch, breakpoints, fluid type — complements Gary's a11y components)
- Nora: technical-storytelling (narrative structures for technical content)
- Ari: technical-seo-patterns (on-page, structured data, crawl, CWV)
- Grace: accessibility-testing-methodology (WCAG testing, SR flows — complements Gary's build patterns)

Writing order: Nora first (clearest fit, becomes template).
Dee's feedback incorporated: Dana's skill stays practical, Blake/Grace explicitly boundary with Gary.

title: Site ownership handoff from Engineering
description: Accepted dispatch from engineering (2026-01-31, site-ownership-handoff). Web Ops now owns the team_skills website, GitHub Pages hosting, Dev.to mirror, and all published content. First steps: site audit, publishing cadence, SEO baseline, accessibility review.
close_reason: Closed

comments.author: LAPTOP-39891RM5\Folk
comments.text:
Dana's initial site audit (visual review, not tool-measured):

STRENGTHS:
- Blog content is genuinely good (Cold Critic piece especially)
- Clean semantic HTML, accessibility foundations present (reduced motion, high contrast, focus states)
- Site structure is sound, blog index is clean

ISSUES:
- Homepage is a wall: 8 sections, no visual hierarchy, everything same weight
- Dark theme is generic dev-tool palette (navy/pink/cyan) — no identity
- 15MB demo.gif — needs compressed video or replacement
- Persona roster is stale (shows only Engineering team, not Web Ops or QA)
- No favicon (404 on load)
- Blog dates are vague ('January 2026', no specific dates)
- No clear visual direction or brand identity

RECOMMENDATION: The content is the asset. The visual layer needs a creative direction, not a reskin. Will plan first steps with the team.

comments.author: LAPTOP-39891RM5\Folk
comments.text:
Dispatches sent to Engineering and QA (both low priority):
- Engineering: How should your personas be represented? Anything stale?
- QA: Do you want representation on the site? What's your pitch?

Both teams will respond whenever they pick up. Not blocking on this — we can start planning the redesign direction now and incorporate their input when it arrives.

comments.author: LAPTOP-39891RM5\Folk
comments.text:
DIRECTION DECIDED — Team consensus reached 2026-01-31:

STRATEGIC DIRECTION:
- GitHub repo = the tool (README, install, docs)
- vibecoder.buzz = the blog (content, thought leadership)
- Current homepage retired (duplicates README)
- Blog becomes the site

TEAM VOTES:
- Dana: Proceed
- Dee: Proceed (blog needs proper front door)
- Nora: Proceed (editorial voice: project blog, 'The Skills Team' byline)
- Ari: Proceed (audit indexing before domain migration)
- Grace: Proceed (no a11y regression, no broken links, audit before launch)

EDITORIAL DECISIONS:
- Voice: Project blog ('we'), not personal. Human as editor.
- Migration: Build for vibecoder.buzz, deploy to GH Pages first. Domain move after Ari audits indexing.

NEXT: Break into work items.

title: Add redirect stub for old homepage
description: Ensure hakal.github.io/team_skills/ doesn't 404 after homepage retirement. Either redirect to GitHub repo or serve a minimal stub pointing visitors to the repo and blog. Grace requirement: no broken links.
close_reason: Closed

title: Build blog site from approved design
description: Blake implements the blog site. Replaces current homepage. Clean blog index with front door copy, post listing, individual post pages. Maintain existing accessibility foundations (semantic HTML, focus states, reduced motion, high contrast). No 15MB GIF.
close_reason: Closed

title: Add Open Graph and Twitter card meta tags
description: No OG or Twitter card tags on any page. Shared links show as bare URLs with no preview. Add og:title, og:description, og:url, og:type, og:image and twitter:card, twitter:title, twitter:description to all pages. Need a default social image (og:image).
close_reason: Added Open Graph (og:title, og:description, og:url, og:type, og:site_name) and Twitter card (twitter:card, twitter:title, twitter:description) meta tags to all 5 pages. No og:image yet (need a social preview image - low priority).

title: Investigate Dev.to posting issue
description: Previous sessions had a problem posting to Dev.to (https://dev.to/theskillsteam). API key is in .keys/devto_key.txt. If the issue persists, user will post manually. QA team has been dispatched for support. Reproduce and fix, or document the workaround.
close_reason: Closed

title: Audit current site indexing and SEO baseline
description: Ari audits: what pages are indexed by search engines? What backlinks exist? What search equity do we risk losing in a domain migration? Report findings so we can plan redirects for vibecoder.buzz migration.
close_reason: SEO baseline audit complete. Zero Google indexing, no robots.txt, no sitemap, no canonical/OG/Twitter tags. Dev.to is indexed. Created follow-up beads: 0sm, bj2, fz2, b0a, o3e.

title: Run existing blog posts through Blog Release Protocol
description: Retroactively run all 4 existing blog posts through the new Blog Release Protocol (TEAM.md). Known issues to address: (1) Parenthetical title pattern on dispatch-protocol and cold-critic posts. (2) No JSON-LD structured data on any post. (3) Possible voice/ending formula creep (bolded takeaway lists). Posts to audit: plan-before-code.html, building-langley.html, cold-critic.html, dispatch-protocol.html. Run each through all 6 protocol steps: Nora (content), Dee (voice/pattern), Blake (build), Ari (SEO), Grace (a11y), Dana (final read).

title: Write dispatch protocol blog post
description: Story-first article about inter-team communication. Real framing: eng team built more teams to offload work, then realized they'd built silos with no communication. Research from _skills/.team/research/inter-team-communication.md becomes evidence, not the story. Follow plan-before-code article pattern (problem, failed approach, insight, solution). Title candidates: 'We Built 3 AI Teams Then Realized They Could Not Talk to Each Other' / 'Our AI Teams Had a Communication Problem (The Fix Was From 1995)'.
close_reason: Published. Factchecked by Engineering, one fix applied (JSON not YAML frontmatter). Post live at hakal.github.io/web_ops/blog/dispatch-protocol.html

title: Write blog post: first SEO skill in the Agent Skills ecosystem
description: Ari's technical-seo-patterns skill is the first SEO coverage in the entire Agent Skills ecosystem. Zero results across official (anthropics/skills), community (agentskills, skillmatic-ai, Prat011), and broad GitHub search. Story angle: The Agent Skills Ecosystem Has Zero SEO Coverage (So We Built the First One). Research source: .team/research/base-skills-catalog-search.md. Follow established post pattern: problem, research, insight, solution.
close_reason: Published. Blog Release Protocol complete: content (Nora), voice rewrite (Dee — broke three-beat ending pattern), build (Blake), SEO with JSON-LD Article+BreadcrumbList (Ari), accessibility (Grace), final read (Dana+user).

title: Resume skill: Dee — ux-heuristic-evaluation
description: Codify Dee's UX critique knowledge into a SKILL.md at discerning-dee/resume/ux-heuristic-evaluation/SKILL.md. Nielsen's heuristics, Gestalt principles, Fitts' law, Hick's law, cognitive load patterns. The codified principles she critiques against.
close_reason: SKILL.md written at discerning-dee/resume/ux-heuristic-evaluation/SKILL.md. Covers Nielsen's 10 heuristics (applied), Gestalt principles, cognitive load patterns (Hick's, Fitts's, Miller's), severity rating, evaluation process. Grace approved.
